clinical_study.brief_title: Lung Ultrasound Versus Dynamic Lung Compliance to Detect the Optimum PEEP After Alveolar Recruitment for Patients Undergoing Laparoscopic Gastric Sleeve Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Lung Ultrasound Versus Dynamic Lung Compliance to Detect the Optimum PEEP After Alveolar Recruitment for Patients Undergoing Laparoscopic Gastric Sleeve Surgery, Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate The role of transthoracic lung US as a clinical tool in Comparison to dynamic lung compliance for detection of optimum PEEP for obese patients undergoing laparoscopic gastric sleeve surgery.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: detection of the optimum PEEP which is measured in mmHg
primary_outcome.description: the optimum PEEP will be detected after alveolar recruitment either by dynamic lung compliance or by lung ultarsound views

secondary_outcome.description: patients will be monitored for detection of postoperative pulmonary complictaios as atelectasis , pneumothorax , respiratory failure

arm_group.arm_group_label: dynamic lung compliance for detection of optimum PEEP
arm_group.description: detection of optimum PEEP by measurement of the dynamic lung compliance (by the ventilator machine) after lung recruitment

arm_group.arm_group_label: Lung ultrasound for detection of the optimum PEEP
arm_group.description: Lung ultrasound will be used to detect the optimum PEEP after lung recruitment

intervention.description: dynamic lung compliance measurements will be used for detection of the optimum PEEP after alveolar recruitment
intervention.arm_group_label: dynamic lung compliance for detection of optimum PEEP

intervention.description: lung ultrasound views will be used for detection of the optimum PEEP after alveolar recruitment
intervention.arm_group_label: Lung ultrasound for detection of the optimum PEEP
